text:
I have not logged into my account for a couple of months (and have not made any api requests since the beginning of March).
Now I went to check and my account is closed.

No any message on my email.

From the support I have this:

```I have looked through your account and can see that your account has been closed on business grounds. The decision to close your account was made by our Account Security Team, and whilst I can understand your frustration, I'm afraid we wouldn't be able to divulge specific details pertaining to the closure as this is not made available to us. What I can confirm is that the decision was made in line with our Terms and Conditions and I'm afraid isn't something that can be appealed.```
Mmmm, I understand that the subject of this channel is a little different, but I have nowhere to ask.

Chances of getting your money then? There are not many, I do not even remember how many, but there was.
Chances of getting a refund fee for access to the exchange api?
Has anyone recently had this?
Any advice?

text: email bdp directly, have you been placing any bets? just collecting data?

elements.text: email bdp directly, have you been placing any bets? just collecting data?

text: place alote before, before march mostly collect data - but only couple month

elements.text: place alote before, before march mostly collect data - but only couple month

text: Are occasional ANGX-0006 "UNEXPECTED ERROR" API messages anything to be concerned about? I've always assumed these were just an acceptable error due to the nature of Betfairs slight flakiness?
